title: артём
text:
Hi, I’m a former UBC Vancouver student in Khanh Dao Duc’s lab.
My general interests are in biology, software and mathematics. I have done work in structural biology infrastrucutre, ML applications to cryoEM, the heterogeneity problem and shape analysis. I built and maintain ribosome.xyz.
Outside of academia, I’ve had a few backend roles. I enjoy running, music, mathematics, history; i planted around 250,000 trees in the north-west of Canada between 2016 and 2018. My favorite book is The Name of the Rose and piece of music is Concierto De Aranjuez.
I can be reached at rtkushner@gmail.com.

title: Papers
text:
Structural heterogeneities of the ribosome: new frontiers and opportunities for cryo-EM
    
      Molecules (2020)
    
    Frédéric Poitevin, Artem Kushner, Xinpei Li, and Khanh Dao Duc
    
      This paper explores the structural heterogeneities of the ribosome across evolutionary, cellular, temporal and conformational landscapes.
    
  

    
      
        
          
          
        
      
    
  



  
    Application of transport-based metric for continuous interpolation between cryo-EM density maps
    
      AIMS Mathematics (2022)
    
    Arthur Ecoffet, Geoffrey Woollard, Artem Kushner, and Frédéric Poitevin, Khanh Dao Duc
    
      We present an approach to interpolating between cryo-EM density maps based on the theory of optimal transport
    
  

    
      
        
          
          
        
      
        
          
          
        
      
        
          
          
        
      
    
  



  
    RiboXYZ: a comprehensive database for visualizing and analyzing ribosome structures
    
      Nucleic Acids Research (2023)
    
    Artem Kushner, Anton S. Petrov, and Khanh Dao Duc
    
      https://ribosome.xyz
    
  

    
      
        
          
          
        
      
    
  



  
    Computational methods for unraveling ribosome structural heterogeneity
    
      Royal Society: Ribosome Heterogeneity and Specialisation Workshop (Oct 16, 2023)
    
    Artem Kushner, Shiqi Yu, Aryan Tajmir Riahi, and Simcha Srebnik, Khanh Dao Duc
    
      We shared some computational methods for analyzing ribosome structural heterogeneity.
